verses.verse: Now Sarai <WH8297> Abram <WH87>'s wife <WH802> gave birth to <WH3205> him no <WH3808> sons <WH3205>: and she had a handmaid <WH8198>, an Egyptian <WH4713>, whose name <WH8034> was Hagar <WH1904>.

And Sarai <WH8297> said <WH559> unto Abram <WH87>, See now <WH3068>, the Lord has prevented <WH6113> me from bearing <WH3205>: I pray you <WH935>, go in unto my maid <WH8198>; it may <WH194> be that I may obtain sons <WH1129> by her <WH87>. And Abram listened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of Sarai <WH8297>.

And Sarai <WH8297> Abram <WH87>'s wife <WH802> took <WH3947> Hagar <WH1904> her maid <WH8198> the Egyptian <WH4713>, after <WH7093> Abram <WH87> had lived <WH3427> ten <WH6235> years <WH8141> in the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667>, and gave <WH5414> her to her husband <WH376> Abram <WH87> to be his wife <WH802>.
And he went in <WH935> unto Hagar <WH1904>, and she conceived <WH2029>: and when she saw <WH7200> that she had conceived <WH2029>, her mistress <WH1404> was despised <WH7043> in her eyes <WH5869>.

And Sarai <WH8297> said <WH559> unto Abram <WH87>, My wrong <WH2555> is because of you <WH5414>: I have given my maid <WH8198> into your bosom <WH2436>; and when she saw <WH7200> that she had conceived <WH2029>, I was despised <WH7043> in her eyes <WH5869>: the Lord <WH3068> judge between me and you <WH8199>.

But Abram <WH87> said <WH559> unto Sarai <WH8297>, Behold <WH8198>, your maid is in your hand <WH3027>; do <WH6213> to her as it pleases you <WH2896>. And when Sarai <WH8297> dealt harshly with <WH6031> her <WH1272>, she fled from her face <WH6440>.
And the angel <WH4397> of the Lord <WH3068> found her <WH4672> by a fountain <WH5869> of water <WH4325> in the wilderness <WH4057>, by the fountain <WH5869> in the way <WH1870> to Shur <WH7793>.

And he said <WH559>, Hagar <WH1904>, Sarai <WH8297>'s maid <WH8198>, from where <WH335> did you come <WH935>? And where will you go <WH3212>? And she said <WH559>, I flee <WH1272> from the face <WH6440> of my mistress <WH1404> Sarai <WH8297>.
And the angel <WH4397> of the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her <WH7725>, Return to your mistress <WH1404>, and submit <WH6031> yourself under her hands <WH3027>.
And the angel <WH4397> of the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her <WH7235>, I will multiply your seed <WH2233> exceedingly <WH7235>, that it shall not be numbered <WH5608> for multitude <WH7230>.

And the angel <WH4397> of the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her <WH2009>, Behold, you are with child <WH2030>, and shall bear <WH3205> a son <WH1121>, and shall call <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Ishmael <WH3458>; because the Lord <WH3068> has heard <WH8085> your affliction <WH6040>.

And he will be a wild <WH6501> man <WH120>; his hand <WH3027> will be against every man <WH3027>, and every man's hand against him <WH7931>; and he shall live in the presence <WH6440> of all his brothers <WH251>.

And she called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the Lord <WH3068> that spoke <WH1696> unto her <WH410>, You God see me <WH7210>: for she said <WH559>, Have I also here <WH1988> seen <WH7200> him <WH310> that sees me <WH7210>?
Wherefore the well <WH875> was called <WH7121> Beer <WH883>–lahai–roi; behold <WH6946>, it is between Kadesh and Bered <WH1260>.

And Hagar <WH1904> gave birth to <WH3205> Abram <WH87> a son <WH1121>: and Abram <WH87> called <WH7121> his son <WH1121>'s name <WH8034>, which Hagar <WH1904> gave birth to <WH3205>, Ishmael <WH3458>.
And Abram <WH87> was eighty <WH8084> and six <WH8337> years <WH8141> old <WH1121>, when Hagar <WH1904> gave birth to <WH3205> Ishmael <WH3458> to Abram <WH87>.
